Key Match Events: The Mavericks held the Lakers below 100 points, achieving their goal.
LeBron James had a near triple-double, but the Mavericks mostly held Anthony Davis in check.
Pre-Game Insights: Spencer Dinwiddie mentioned that their goal was to hold the Lakers below 100 points.
Post-Match Reflections: The Mavericks finally broke their five-game losing streak with a big win over the Los Angeles Lakers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks hit seven more threes than the Lakers, with Quentin Grimes delivering one of his best performances with 23 points, nine rebounds, and six assists.
The Mavericks allowed the Lakers to 45.3% from the floor and 31.4% from three.
Others: The Mavericks struggled with turnovers, but managed to keep them down to 10 against the Lakers.
